description: Defines the canonical file format requirements for constitutional and policy artifacts in .intent/, ensuring deterministic parsing, schema validation, and long-term machine governance.

rules.description: The canonical format for constitutional content in .intent/ must be JSON.
rules.rationale: CORE treats .intent/ as a machine-oriented source of truth. JSON provides deterministic parsing, strong schema validation, broad tooling support, and unambiguous structure, which is required for automated governance and reliable UI rendering.

rules.description: Legacy YAML intent artifacts may be tolerated during a controlled migration period, but are not canonical.
rules.notes: Target full JSON adoption by end of 2026.
rules.rationale: A hard cutover can block delivery and increase operational risk. A staged migration preserves velocity while converging on JSON as the single canonical representation.

title: Constitution Format Standard
